events.name: June Meetup: Java 8... and Mister Paul Maritz!!!
events.description: First talk: Paul Maritz (starting at 7PM) Paul Maritz is the CEO of Pivotal. He is well known in the industry as a great leader and a visionary. At the beginning of his career, he spent 14 years at Microsoft and became part of the MS Executive committee. After that, he did some philanthropy work in Africa and became the highly respected CEO of VMware [masked]). During Paul’s time at VMware, the virtualization giant purchased 2 startup companies: SpringSource and Cloud Foundry. In 2013, SpringSource and Cloud Foundry have been moved to a new spin-off company called Pivotal Inc. Paul now is the CEO of Pivotal. He is the leader that we all dream to have. We are thrilled to have Paul speak at the Singapore Spring User Group. We will only have 30 minutes of his time so please be on time! Second talk: Java 8 Frans Effendi and Puneet Dewan (both work at PayPal) will discuss about the cool Java 8 features that you should be using. Java 8 was released in March last year. This release is packed with some really exciting features. In this session, they will go over: 1.Lambda expressions 2. Streams 3.New Date and Time API. Come and let’s explore how Java 8 enhances our productivity! Also, please be aware that we will be in Suntec.
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: Meteor June Meetup
events.description: Hello everyone, It's time for our June MeteorSG meetup! This is kind of a placeholder for now as some people are starting to ask when the next meetup is :-) *** Call for speakers! Message us on our facebook page (link below) or comment below if you have anything interesting to present! *** Doors open from 7pm and we will start the talks promptly at 7.30pm. ==================================== Meetup Agenda: #1 - EJSON - Duncan Foster #2 - PayPal Express Checkout with Meteor - Albert Tirtohadi #3 - Show & Tell: - Package for Meteor Scaffolding - Tze Ken Le e #4 - Meteor Clinic: - We are going to try something new - if anyone has any specific Meteor questions or problems they can ask the community here to see if someone can help. So please make a note of any questions/problems you have! Remember - there is no such thing as a 'stupid question' ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/No_such_thing_as_a_stupid_question ) #5 Housekeeping - Reminder that we have the following communication channels: Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/meteorjssg Slack: https://meteorsg.slack.com Website & Blog: http://singapore.meteor.com/ #6 Socializing / Networking ==================================== We do also try to allocate some time for anyone to share about any Meteor projects they are working on or would like to talk about. We should have a projector at the venue so please just bring a laptop if you would like to do this. Some talks may be interactive so if you wish to follow along then please bring along a laptop (preferably with Meteor and MongoDB pre-installed). Location: Nitrous.IO office Remember to bring photo ID to get through building security. Directions: From Chinatown MRT - Take Exit A - Go straight in Pagoda St. - Turn right after Myer's Jewellery - Look for a red door with a Golden Lion Head door knocker (same side as the Myer's Jewellery) Landmarks - Swasdee Thai Food Organizers : Tze Ken Lee , Cofounder & Director at InnoMonster Pte. Ltd. 5 years of experience in web development. Rick Behl, Old school programmer, hacker and entrepreneur
